meanings.definition: The state of being swollen or distended.
meanings.sent1: The turgidity of the balloon made it difficult to tie.
meanings.sent2: The plant's turgidity was evident after a heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The turgidity of the marshmallow made it impossible to fit in the cup.
meanings.sent4: The turgidity of the river after the storm was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The turgidity of the sponge soaked up all the water quickly.

meanings.definition: The quality of being firm or rigid.
meanings.sent1: The turgidity of the apple indicated its freshness.
meanings.sent2: The turgidity of the tree's branches provided stability.
meanings.sent3: The turgidity of the ruler made it a poor choice for a bendy straw.
meanings.sent4: The turgidity of the mountain range was awe-inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The turgidity of the ice sculpture amazed the onlookers.
